etymologies: early 19th century: modern Latin (genus name), from the name of the Titan Rhea

definitions: a large flightless bird of South American grasslands, resembling a small ostrich with grayish-brown plumage.

notes.text: Family Rheidae: two species, Rhea americana and Pterocnemia pennata

shortDefinitions: large flightless bird of South American grasslands, resembling small ostrich with greyish-brown plumage
